title: Similar fonts to Optimo's 'Stanley'?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226174219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Stanley_6170.gif)

Hello - -curious to find out if there are any other fonts our there with similar forms to this lovely new face by Ludovic Balland... I am particularly interested in the sharply delineated junctions (brackets?) between stem and the serif, for example in the 'I'...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226174219im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StanleyIt_6617.gif)

Thanks as ever for any useful tips!

Matt

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [It.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226174219/http:/typophile.com/files/It.jpg) | 4.54 KB |
author: mvor

comments.content: The only one I remember is [Larish Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150226174219/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/larish-neue) by Radim Peško.
Anyone out there know of a similar approach to brackets; or is this really unique?
